description.narrative: Mongolia - Rail Project - LeaseCo Establishment Activity: The Mongolia, Rail Project, LeaseCo Establishment Activity was used in the past for accounting purposes but it is not currently an active activity for the program. It has no funds either committed or disbursed against it and has a sector code of 99810 (sector not specified).

condition.narrative: (1) UBTZ shall deliver annually to MCA-Mongolia (A) a report in which UBTZ specifies the tracks, bridges and culverts that it has maintained and improved during the 12 months immediately preceding such report, which shall include approximately 50 km of tracks upgrade to R65 rail per year during such period (provided that approximately 35 km of such annual tracks upgrades will suffice for each of 2007 and 2008), certified by the CEO of UBTZ, setting out work planned, commissioned and completed during the relevant period and (B) a report by MRA, satisfactory to MCC, evidencing the implementation of such maintenance and improvements. (2) Continued progress acceptable to MCC has been made to remediate UBTZ's financial accounting and reporting processes in order to state the books and records in accordance with IAS, as demonstrated by quarterly progress reports satisfactory to MCC from the international accounting firm that has conducted a UBTZ financial management remediation project in response to the UBTZ "Financial Accounting Assessment" report demonstrating significant progress and achievement of results corresponding to the recommendations outlined in the accounting assessment report. (3) UBTZ has delivered to MCA-Mongolia, in form and substance acceptable to MCC, an independent audit report conducted by an international accounting firm assessing whether the most recent financial statements of UBTZ have been prepared and presented in accordance with IAS. For the avoidance of doubt, such audit report containing a "Disclaimer of Opinion" will constitute failure to fulfill this requirement whereas such audit report containing an "Unqualified Opinion", "Qualified Opinion" or "Adverse Opinion" will satisfy this requirement so long as material audit findings cited in a "Qualified Opinion" or "Adverse Opinion" have been sufficiently addressed by UBTZ management in an "Audit Finding Response" report.

(i) Authorization for lessees of the rail equipment funded under the LeaseCo Operation Activity, consisting of locomotives, wagons, track maintenance equipment and signaling equipment (i.e., the LeaseCo Assets), to access UBTZ's tracks (subject to reasonable requirements such as payment of a reasonable access fee and renewal costs, and compliance with safety requirements); (ii) Authorization for UBTZ to lease LeaseCo Assets from LeaseCo at fair market rates; (iii) Authorization for an internationally recognized accounting firm to examine UBTZ's accounting books and financial records and make efforts that are required in order to (A) carry out an assessment intended to determine what would be required to bring them into accordance with IAS and (B) address the issues identified in such assessment in order for UBTZ to present their financial statements in compliance with IAS; and(iv) Authorization for an independent international auditing firm to audit UBTZ's accounting books and financial records each year during the Compact Term.

MCA-Mongolia shall ensure that (A) the Environmental Impact Assessment ("EIA") and associated Environmental Management Plan ("EMP") covering all rail-related construction activities are completed in accordance with the provisions set forth in this Compact and in relevant Supplemental Agreements, (B) any feasibility studies and final rail designs are consistent with and incorporate the outcomes of the EIA, as applicable, and (C) there is continued compliance with the EMP during the Rail Project implementation.

UBTZ shall deliver to MCA-Mongolia, in form and substance acceptable to MCC, an independent audit report conducted by an international accounting firm assessing whether the financial statements of UBTZ for the second consecutive year have been prepared and presented in accordance with IAS. For the avoidance of doubt, such report containing a "Disclaimer of Opinion" or "Adverse Opinion" will constitute failure to fulfill this requirement whereas "Unqualified Opinion" or "Qualified Opinion" will satisfy this condition so long as material audit findings cited in a "Qualified Opinion" have been sufficiently addressed by UBTZ management in an "Audit Finding Response" report.
